TopicTitle: Modding live stream - Thursday 30th July 21:00 BST

Articles.Content:
Newbie modding tutorial. Mostly covering Unity. Initial setup, part tools, model import, materials, common problems, troubleshooting, maybe a little animation. All welcome!

[http://www.twitch.tv/kerbalfoundries](http://www.twitch.tv/kerbalfoundries)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-28T12:56:26Z" title="07/28/2015 12:56  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 28, 2015</time> by lo-fi**
  
Update date

Ohhhh yeeeeeees! What kind of wheels do you mean? Landing wheels/gears or rover wheels? I would be very happy to see you making landing gears, I still didn't completely figured out how exactly they need to be setted up..

Oh, and will you also record the stream and upload it to youtube later? That would be great, since I will probably not able to watch it!![:sealed:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_lipssealed.gif)
Nice idea. I'll show up to help answer questions in chat and maybe even ask some of my own ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> I'll post the twitch link shortly when I can remember what it is!

I assume it's this? [http://www.twitch.tv/kerbalfoundries](http://www.twitch.tv/kerbalfoundries)

I definitely encourage people to attend this. The last one was what made me actually understand wheel colliders ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Be sure to test it this time. I remember the echo on the last one was rather frustrating. Will there be facecam? ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

> 
> Ohhhh yeeeeeees! What kind of wheels do you mean? Landing wheels/gears or rover wheels? I would be very happy to see you making landing gears, I still didn't completely figured out how exactly they need to be setted up..
> Oh, and will you also record the stream and upload it to youtube later? That would be great, since I will probably not able to watch it!![:sealed:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_lipssealed.gif)

Not sure yet. There seem to be quite a few people who would like some insight into how to the tracks are made. It's a hell of a process, and took me months to perfect, so this is about the only way to pass the info on in a concise fashion. I have yet to tackle landing gear - my plugin needs an animation update to get that going really, but I do kinda have an eye on it. Probably not this time! Yes, I'll record and post ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> Nice idea. I'll show up to help answer questions in chat and maybe even ask some of my own ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Excellent, thank you! If Zodius is around, I'll try and spend a few minutes at the end going through the plugin stuff in-depth for you guys too.

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> I assume it's this? [http://www.twitch.tv/kerbalfoundries](http://www.twitch.tv/kerbalfoundries)
> I definitely encourage people to attend this. The last one was what made me actually understand wheel colliders ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
> 
> Be sure to test it this time. I remember the echo on the last one was rather frustrating. Will there be facecam? ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Yeah, I got it nailed to do the second stream and the YT ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

And nobody needs to see that ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)
Post a reminder closer to the day/hour.
Aye, Cap'n ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Apologies to everyone that was planning to tune in. Real life has got in the way in rather a major way today, so I'm going to have to postpone ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif) provisionally, let's say next Wednesday.

Sorry everyone, I was looking forward to doing this!
Aww, and I just on my way out to get popcorn ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Go grab more popcorn, we're on for tomorrow ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) I've chosen a design, and will be making a simple track. Modeling, rigging the skin, setting up in Unity, exporting and configuring. Will probably skip texturing as it's out of scope (apart from track surface to show how the module works).

Yay, tracks! No need to cover texturing, but the stuff about setting the UVs for the treads would be very useful.

Edit: Probably worth editing the thread title, as the date is still last week

Haha! Thanks, I'd overlooked that ![:blush:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_embarrassed.gif)

Yep, I'll go through that. Its very easy - or at least it is in 3d studio. I'd hope there are similar tools in Blender, but it wouldn't be the end of the world if not.

If the setup is similar to how it was back when the tracks were new, I can safely say setting up the UV's for the tracks are indeed very easy.

I'll be dropping in on this too, I'm curious as to your workflow.
Excellent, be great to have you along. I think the oval track I just modified the config for, so yup, it's the same!
Running a little late! 21:15
OK, no idea how many people were watching, but hope that was interesting/useful! Any questions, please feel free.

VODs available here:

[http://www.twitch.tv/kerbalfoundries/b/665612357](http://www.twitch.tv/kerbalfoundries/b/665612357)

[http://www.twitch.tv/kerbalfoundries/b/665621189](http://www.twitch.tv/kerbalfoundries/b/665621189)
Cheers dude. Had to stop/start the stream to down the quality a little, which is why there are two

Anyone up for some more? Thinking Thursday, 21:00 BST.

Got some notes on covering basic unity stuff: initial setup, part tools install, importing, exporting, colliders, materials, export, common problems, troubleshooting. Might even get into a little animation. This will be a newbie friendly one, right from the start. YouTube from the last one is up, will post a link later.

this sounds awesome! i assume it will be on youtube afterwards as well?

EDIT: thursday is the 30th...
Yeah, I always record them. Thanks, no idea how I got that wrong!!
no worries! I won't be able to be there during the live stream (starts during work for me, and I don't have internet in my new apartment yet) but I'll be sure to watch the youtube.

Tricky when we have people from all over the planet in different time zones! It's always available for a little while after as a past broadcast on Twitch, but I usually get around to sticking up the YouTube sooner or later.
Apologies, I can't get the software to play ball tonight. My internet connection is running slow, which may be causing it. Will try to fix and reschedule! Or may just produce a YouTube
That sucks. Then again, live broadcasts can get tedious at times. Better to be able to skip the awkward stuff.
